com.nexmo.security
Class VerifySignature

java.lang.Object
  com.nexmo.security.VerifySignature
All Implemented Interfaces:
SecurityConstants
public class VerifySignature
extends java.lang.Object
implements SecurityConstants

VerifySignature.java

Helper class to assist with verifying sigmatures on inbound message requests Upon receiving a request, the HttpServletRequest object should be passed to the verifyRequestSignature method along with the secret key assigned to your account. This will verify that the message request was signed by and originated from the Nexmo platform. Additionally, the timestamp will be checked to ensure it is within an acceptable time window to help ensure that a properly signed request has not been intercepted and later re-played Created on 5 January 2011, 17:34

Version:
1.0
Author:
Paul Cook

Method Detail

verifyRequestSignature

public static boolean verifyRequestSignature(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                             java.lang.String secretKey)
looks at the current http request and verifies that the request signature, if supplied is valid.

Parameters:
request - The servlet request object to be verified
secretKey - the pre-shared secret key used by the sender of the request to create the signature
Returns:
boolean returns true only if the signature is correct for this request and secret key.
